overview_of_class: This course is an introduction to econometrics, a field in which statistical tools and data are utilized in the analysis of economic questions. We will start with simple linear regression, incorporating tools of statistical inference such as confidence intervals and hypothesis testing. Then we will incorporate more variables with multiple linear regression, and explore nonlinear regression functions, binary dependent variables, and other topics. A key part of this course will be learning to use the statistical software, Stata. Students will analyze real datasets with Stata on problem sets during the quarter, building a valuable skill set.
name: Introduction to Applied Econometrics
title: WCAS ECON 281-0-20 Introduction to Applied Econometrics

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course is an introduction to econometrics, a field in which statistical tools and data are utilized in the analysis of economic questions. We will start with simple linear regression, incorporating tools of statistical inference such as confidence intervals and hypothesis testing. Then we will incorporate more variables with multiple linear regression, and explore nonlinear regression functions, binary dependent variables, and other topics. A key part of this course will be learning to use the statistical software, Stata. Students will analyze real datasets with Stata on problem sets during the quarter, building a valuable skill set.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Problem sets, one midterm, and a final exam

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
We will use "Introductory Econometrics: A Modern Approach" by Jeffrey Wooldridge (any edition is fine). The latest edition (6th) ISBN is: 978-1305270107.
Students will also be required to purchase a 6-month Small Stata License using Northwestern's educational pricing for $38.

subject: ECON
